problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

decision_variables.description: Number of boxes used to pack all items, minimized as objective
Assignment of each item to a box
decision_variables.initialization: item_box_assignments : Annotated[list[Annotated[int, Field(strict=True, ge=1, le=10)]], Len(10, 10)]

decision_variables.description: X and Y positions of each item within its assigned box

objective:
# --- objective ---
def calculate_objective(item_box_assignments: DSList(length=10, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=10))) -> int:
    max_box_id: int = 0
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        box_id: int = item_box_assignments[i]
        if box_id > max_box_id:
            max_box_id = box_id
    return max_box_id

objective = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)
nr_used_boxes = objective
minimize(objective)
constraints:
# -- Constraints --


# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(
    items: DSList(length=10, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=10, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=10)),
    positions: DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
) -> None:
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        item: Item = items[i]
        pos: BoxAssignment = positions[i]
        # Ensure item fits within the box dimensions
        assert pos.x + item.width <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert pos.y + item.height <= BOX_HEIGHT
        # Ensure assignment consistency
        assert pos.box_id == assignments[i]

items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, x_y_positions)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def no_overlap(
    items: DSList(length=10, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=10, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=10)),
    positions: DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
) -> None:
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check items in the same box
            if assignments[i] == assignments[j]:
                pos_i: BoxAssignment = positions[i]
                pos_j: BoxAssignment = positions[j]
                item_i: Item = items[i]
                item_j: Item = items[j]
                
                # Check for non-overlapping rectangles
                assert (
                    pos_i.x + item_i.width <= pos_j.x or
                    pos_j.x + item_j.width <= pos_i.x or
                    pos_i.y + item_i.height <= pos_j.y or
                    pos_j.y + item_j.height <= pos_i.y
                )

no_overlap(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, x_y_positions)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_item_assignment_consistency(
    assignments: DSList(length=10, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=10)),
    positions: DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
) -> None:
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        assert positions[i].box_id == assignments[i]

ensure_item_assignment_consistency(item_box_assignments, x_y_positions)

N_X_Y_POSITIONS : int = 10

minimize(objective)

# -- Constraints --


# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(
    items: DSList(length=10, elem_type=Item),
    item_box_assignments: DSList(length=10, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=10)),
    x_y_positions: DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):

        pos: BoxAssignment = x_y_positions[i]
        # Ensure item fits within box dimensions

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def no_overlap_in_boxes(
    items: DSList(length=10, elem_type=Item),
    x_y_positions: DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check overlap if both items are in the same box
            if x_y_positions[i].box_id == x_y_positions[j].box_id:
                item1: Item = items[i]
                item2: Item = items[j]
                pos1: BoxAssignment = x_y_positions[i]
                pos2: BoxAssignment = x_y_positions[j]
                
                # Check for non-overlapping conditions
                # If any of these is true, there's no overlap
                # We assert that at least one of these non-overlapping conditions holds
                assert (
                    pos1.x + item1.width <= pos2.x or  # item1 is left of item2
                    pos2.x + item2.width <= pos1.x or  # item2 is left of item1
                    pos1.y + item1.height <= pos2.y or # item1 is below item2
                    pos2.y + item2.height <= pos1.y    # item2 is below item1
                )

no_overlap_in_boxes(ITEMS, x_y_positions)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_item_box_assignment_validity(
    item_box_assignments: DSList(length=10, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=10))
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        # Each item must be assigned to exactly one box
        assert item_box_assignments[i] >= 1
        assert item_box_assignments[i] <= 10

ensure_item_box_assignment_validity(item_box_assignments)

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

    assignments: DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment),
    box_width: int,
    box_height: int
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        item_width: int = items[i].width
        item_height: int = items[i].height
        pos_x: int = assignments[i].x
        pos_y: int = assignments[i].y
        assert pos_x + item_width <= box_width
        assert pos_y + item_height <= box_height

items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, BOX_WIDTH, BOX_HEIGHT)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def no_overlap_constraints(
    assignments: DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment),
    items: DSList(length=10, elem_type=Item)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check overlap if both items are in the same box
            if assignments[i].box_id == assignments[j].box_id:
                # Get item dimensions
                w_i: int = items[i].width
                h_i: int = items[i].height
                x_i: int = assignments[i].x
                y_i: int = assignments[i].y
                
                w_j: int = items[j].width
                h_j: int = items[j].height
                x_j: int = assignments[j].x
                y_j: int = assignments[j].y
                
                # Check for non-overlapping: either:
                # - i is to the right of j: x_i >= x_j + w_j
                # - i is to the left of j: x_j >= x_i + w_i
                # - i is above j: y_i >= y_j + h_j
                # - i is below j: y_j >= y_i + h_i
                assert (x_i >= x_j + w_j) or (x_j >= x_i + w_i) or (y_i >= y_j + h_j) or (y_j >= y_i + h_i)

no_overlap_constraints(item_box_assignments, ITEMS)

    assignments: DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment),
    items: DSList(length=10, elem_type=Item),
    box_width: int,
    box_height: int
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        # Ensure item fits within the box dimensions
        assert assignments[i].x + items[i].width <= box_width
        assert assignments[i].y + items[i].height <= box_height
        # Ensure coordinates are non-negative
        assert assignments[i].x >= 0
        assert assignments[i].y >= 0
        # Ensure box_id is within valid range
        assert assignments[i].box_id >= 1
        assert assignments[i].box_id <= 10

ensure_item_box_assignment_validity(item_box_assignments, ITEMS, BOX_WIDTH, BOX_HEIGHT)

full_formulation:
# --- Objects ---


Item = DSRecord({
    "width": DSInt(lb=1, ub=6),
    "height": DSInt(lb=1, ub=18)
})

BoxAssignment = DSRecord({
    "box_id": DSInt(lb=1, ub=10),
    "x": DSInt(lb=0, ub=6),
    "y": DSInt(lb=0, ub=20)
})



# --- Constants and Decision Variables ---
BOX_HEIGHT: int = 20
BOX_WIDTH: int = 6
ITEMS: DSList(length=10, elem_type=Item) = [
    {"width": 2, "height": 10},
    {"width": 3, "height": 18},
    {"width": 6, "height": 6},
    {"width": 6, "height": 17},
    {"width": 1, "height": 17},
    {"width": 3, "height": 10},
    {"width": 3, "height": 12},
    {"width": 4, "height": 7},
    {"width": 3, "height": 10},
    {"width": 1, "height": 12}
]
N_ITEMS: int = 10
nr_used_boxes: DSInt(lb=1, ub=10)
item_box_assignments: DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
x_y_positions: DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
N_ITEMS : int = 10
N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS : int = 10
N_X_Y_POSITIONS : int = 10


# --- objective ---
def calculate_objective(assignments: DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment)) -> DSInt(lb=1, ub=10):
    max_box_id: int = 0
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        if assignments[i].box_id > max_box_id:
            max_box_id = assignments[i].box_id
    return max_box_id

objective = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)
nr_used_boxes = objective
minimize(objective)

    items: DSList(length=10, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment),

):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):

                    assignments[i].y + items[i].height <= assignments[j].y or
                    assignments[j].y + items[j].height <= assignments[i].y
